actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

official_title: A bill to clarify the Federal relationship to the Shawnee Tribe as a distinct Indian tribe, to clarify the status of the members of the Shawnee Tribe, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Shawnee Tribe Status Act of 2000 - Provides for Federal recognition of the Shawnee Tribe as a distinct Indian tribe.Makes the Tribe and its members eligible for all special programs and services provided by the United States to Indians.Requires the Tribe to submit its base membership roll to the Secretary of the Interior for approval.Recognizes the Tribe's constitution and bylaws and governing body.Makes the Tribe eligible to have land acquired in trust for its benefit.Grants the Tribe jurisdiction over its and its members' trust and restricted land.

titles.title: A bill to clarify the Federal relationship to the Shawnee Tribe as a distinct Indian tribe, to clarify the status of the members of the Shawnee Tribe, and for other purposes.
